intro: Isolepis aciformis, commonly known as the spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetland environments such as marshes and pond margins. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences that are often green or brown in color. It is characterized by its dense, spike-like arrangement of flowering stems. Isolepis aciformis plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
